00067 L_Alloc_Pool *INT_Symbol_Table_pool = NULL;
00068 L_Alloc_Pool *INT_Symbol_pool = NULL;

00073  *** INT routines

00077 /* Create and initialize INT_Symbol_Table.
00078  * Creates a hash table of initial size 2 * expected_size rounded up
00079  * to the closest power of two.  (Min hash size 32)
00080  */
00081 INT_Symbol_Table *
00082 INT_new_symbol_table (char *name, int expected_size)
00083 {
00084   INT_Symbol_Table *table;
00085   INT_Symbol **hash;
00086   unsigned int min_size, hash_size;
00087   int i;
00088 
00089   /* If expected size negative, force to be 0 */
00090   if (expected_size < 0)
00091     expected_size = 0;
00092 
00093   /* To prevent infinite loop by sizing algorithm (and running out of
00094    * memory :) ), expected_size must be <= a billion.
00095    */
00096   if (expected_size > 1000000000)
00097     I_punt ("INT_Symbol_Table: unreasonable expected_size (%u)",
00098             expected_size);
00099 
00100   /* Want a minumum size of at least twice the expected size */
00101   min_size = expected_size * 2;
00102 
00103   /* Start with a minumum hash size of 32.  
00104    * (Smaller sizes don't work as well with the hashing algorithm)
00105    */
00106   hash_size = 32;
00107 
00108   /* Double hash_size until min_size is reached or exceeded */
00109   while (hash_size < min_size)
00110     hash_size = hash_size << 1;
00111 
00112 
00113   /* Create new symbol table pool (and symbol pool if necessary) */
00114   if (INT_Symbol_Table_pool == NULL)
00115     {
00116       INT_Symbol_Table_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("INT_Symbol_Table",
00117                                                    sizeof (INT_Symbol_Table),
00118                                                    16);
00119       INT_Symbol_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("INT_Symbol",
00120                                              sizeof (INT_Symbol), 64);
00121     }
00122 
00123   /* Allocate symbol table */
00124   table = (INT_Symbol_Table *) L_alloc (INT_Symbol_Table_pool);
00125 
00126   /* Allocate array for hash */
00127   hash = (INT_Symbol **) malloc (hash_size * sizeof (INT_Symbol *));
00128   if (hash == NULL)
00129     {
00130       I_punt ("INT_new_symbol_table: Out of memory, hash array size %i.",
00131               hash_size);
00132     }
00133 
00134   /* Initialize hash table */
00135   for (i = 0; i < hash_size; i++)
00136     hash[i] = NULL;
00137 
00138   /* Initialize fields */
00139   table->name = strdup (name);
00140   table->hash = hash;
00141   table->hash_size = hash_size;
00142   table->hash_mask = hash_size - 1;   /* AND mask, works only for power of 2 */
00143   /* Resize when count at 75% of hash_size */
00144   table->resize_size = hash_size - (hash_size >> 2);
00145   table->head_symbol = NULL;
00146   table->tail_symbol = NULL;
00147   table->symbol_count = 0;
00148 
00149   return (table);
00150 }
00151 
00152 /* Frees the symbol table, and optionally frees the data pointed to */
00153 void
00154 INT_delete_symbol_table (INT_Symbol_Table * table,
00155                          void (*free_routine) (void *))
00156 {
00157   INT_Symbol *symbol, *next_symbol;
00158 
00159   /* For all the symbols in the table, free each one */
00160   for (symbol = table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL; symbol = next_symbol)
00161     {
00162       /* Get the next symbol before deleting this one */
00163       next_symbol = symbol->next_symbol;
00164 
00165       /* If free routine specified, free data */
00166       if (free_routine != NULL)
00167         free_routine (symbol->data);
00168 
00169       /* Free symbol structure */
00170       L_free (INT_Symbol_pool, symbol);
00171     }
00172 
00173   /* Free the hash array and table name */
00174   free (table->hash);
00175   free (table->name);
00176 
00177   /* Free the table structure */
00178   L_free (INT_Symbol_Table_pool, table);
00179 }
00180 
00181 /* Doubles the symbol table hash array size */
00182 void
00183 INT_resize_symbol_table (INT_Symbol_Table * table)
00184 {
00185   INT_Symbol **new_hash, *symbol, *hash_head;
00186   int new_hash_size;
00187   unsigned int new_hash_mask, new_hash_index;
00188   int i;
00189 
00190   /* Double the size of the hash array */
00191   new_hash_size = table->hash_size * 2;
00192 
00193   /* Allocate new hash array */
00194   new_hash = (INT_Symbol **) malloc (new_hash_size * sizeof (INT_Symbol *));
00195   if (new_hash == NULL)
00196     {
00197       I_punt ("INT_resize_symbol_table: Out of memory, new size %i.",
00198               new_hash_size);
00199     }
00200 
00201   /* Initialize new hash table */
00202   for (i = 0; i < new_hash_size; i++)
00203     new_hash[i] = NULL;
00204 
00205   /* Get the hash mask for the new hash table */
00206   new_hash_mask = new_hash_size - 1;  /* AND mask, works only for power of 2 */
00207 
00208   /* Go though all the symbol and add to new hash table.
00209    * Can totally disreguard old hash links.
00210    */
00211   for (symbol = table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
00212        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
00213     {
00214       /* Get index into hash table to use for this name */
00215       new_hash_index = symbol->value & new_hash_mask;
00216 
00217       /* Add symbol to head of linked list */
00218       hash_head = new_hash[new_hash_index];
00219       symbol->next_hash = hash_head;
00220       symbol->prev_hash = NULL;
00221       if (hash_head != NULL)
00222         hash_head->prev_hash = symbol;
00223       new_hash[new_hash_index] = symbol;
00224     }
00225 
00226   /* Free old hash table */
00227   free (table->hash);
00228 
00229   /* Initialize table fields for new hash table */
00230   table->hash = new_hash;
00231   table->hash_size = new_hash_size;
00232   table->hash_mask = new_hash_mask;
00233   /* Resize when count at 75% of new_hash_size */
00234   table->resize_size = new_hash_size - (new_hash_size >> 2);
00235 }
00236 
00237 
00238 /* Adds structure to symbol table, data is not copied!!! 
00239  * Dynamically increases symbol table's hash array.
00240  * Returns pointer to added symbol.
00241  */
00242 INT_Symbol *
00243 INT_add_symbol (INT_Symbol_Table * table, int value, void *data)
00244 {
00245   INT_Symbol *symbol, *hash_head, *check_symbol, *tail_symbol;
00246   unsigned int hash_index;
00247   int symbol_count;
00248 
00249   /* Increase symbol table size if necessary before adding new symbol.  
00250    * This will change the hash_mask if the table is resized!
00251    */
00252   symbol_count = table->symbol_count;
00253   if (symbol_count >= table->resize_size)
00254     {
00255       INT_resize_symbol_table (table);
00256     }
00257 
00258   /* Allocate a symbol (pool initialized in create table routine) */
00259   symbol = (INT_Symbol *) L_alloc (INT_Symbol_pool);
00260 
00261   /* Initialize fields */
00262   symbol->value = value;
00263   symbol->data = data;
00264   symbol->table = table;
00265 
00266   /* Get tail symbol for ease of use */
00267   tail_symbol = table->tail_symbol;
00268 
00269   /* Add to linked list of symbols */
00270   symbol->next_symbol = NULL;
00271   symbol->prev_symbol = tail_symbol;
00272 
00273   if (tail_symbol == NULL)
00274     table->head_symbol = symbol;
00275   else
00276     tail_symbol->next_symbol = symbol;
00277   table->tail_symbol = symbol;
00278 
00279   /* Get index into hash table to use for this value */
00280   hash_index = value & table->hash_mask;
00281 
00282   /* Get head symbol in current linked list for ease of use */
00283   hash_head = table->hash[hash_index];
00284 
00285 
00286   /* Sanity check (may want to ifdef out later).
00287 
00288    * Check that this symbol's name is not already in the symbol table.
00289    * Punt if it is, since can cause a major debugging nightmare.
00290    */
00291   for (check_symbol = hash_head; check_symbol != NULL;
00292        check_symbol = check_symbol->next_hash)
00293     {
00294       /* If value the same, punt */
00295       if (check_symbol->value == value)
00296         {
00297           I_punt ("INT_add_symbol, %s: cannot add '%i', already in table!",
00298                   table->name, value);
00299         }
00300     }
00301 
00302 
00303   /* Add symbol to head of linked list */
00304   symbol->next_hash = hash_head;
00305   symbol->prev_hash = NULL;
00306   if (hash_head != NULL)
00307     hash_head->prev_hash = symbol;
00308   table->hash[hash_index] = symbol;
00309 
00310   /* Update table's symbol count */
00311   table->symbol_count = symbol_count + 1;
00312 
00313   /* Return symbol added */
00314   return (symbol);
00315 }
00316 
00317 /* Returns a INT_Symbol structure with the desired valuee, or NULL
00318  * if the value is not in the symbol table.
00319  */
00320 INT_Symbol *
00321 INT_find_symbol (INT_Symbol_Table * table, int value)
00322 {
00323   INT_Symbol *symbol;
00324   unsigned int hash_index;
00325 
00326   /* Get the index into the hash table */
00327   hash_index = value & table->hash_mask;
00328 
00329   /* Search the linked list for matching name */
00330   for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00331        symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00332     {
00333       /* Compare values to find match */
00334       if (symbol->value == value)
00335         {
00336           return (symbol);
00337         }
00338     }
00339   return (NULL);
00340 }
00341 
00342 /* 
00343  * Returns the data for desired value, or NULL
00344  * if the name is not in the symbol table.
00345  */
00346 void *
00347 INT_find_symbol_data (INT_Symbol_Table * table, int value)
00348 {
00349   INT_Symbol *symbol;
00350   unsigned int hash_index;
00351 
00352   /* Get the index into the hash table */
00353   hash_index = value & table->hash_mask;
00354 
00355   /* Search the linked list for matching name */
00356   for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00357        symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00358     {
00359       /* Compare values to find match */
00360       if (symbol->value == value)
00361         {
00362           return (symbol->data);
00363         }
00364     }
00365   return (NULL);
00366 }
00367 
00368 /* Deletes symbol and optionally deletes the data using the free routine */
00369 void
00370 INT_delete_symbol (INT_Symbol * symbol, void (*free_routine) (void *))
00371 {
00372   INT_Symbol_Table *table;
00373   INT_Symbol *next_hash, *prev_hash, *next_symbol, *prev_symbol;
00374   unsigned int hash_index;
00375 
00376   /* Get the table the symbol is from */
00377   table = symbol->table;
00378 
00379   /* Get the hash index from the symbol's value */
00380   hash_index = symbol->value & table->hash_mask;
00381 
00382   /* Remove symbol from hash table */
00383   prev_hash = symbol->prev_hash;
00384   next_hash = symbol->next_hash;
00385   if (prev_hash == NULL)
00386     table->hash[hash_index] = next_hash;
00387   else
00388     prev_hash->next_hash = next_hash;
00389 
00390   if (next_hash != NULL)
00391     next_hash->prev_hash = prev_hash;
00392 
00393   /* Remove symbol from symbol list */
00394   prev_symbol = symbol->prev_symbol;
00395   next_symbol = symbol->next_symbol;
00396   if (prev_symbol == NULL)
00397     table->head_symbol = next_symbol;
00398   else
00399     prev_symbol->next_symbol = next_symbol;
00400 
00401   if (next_symbol == NULL)
00402     table->tail_symbol = prev_symbol;
00403   else
00404     next_symbol->prev_symbol = prev_symbol;
00405 
00406 
00407   /* If free routine specified, free symbol data */
00408   if (free_routine != NULL)
00409     free_routine (symbol->data);
00410 
00411   /* Free symbol structure */
00412   L_free (INT_Symbol_pool, symbol);
00413 
00414   /* Decrement table symbol count */
00415   table->symbol_count--;
00416 }
00417 
00418 
00419 /* Prints out the symbol table's hash table (debug routine) */
00420 void
00421 INT_print_symbol_table_hash (FILE * out, INT_Symbol_Table * table)
00422 {
00423   INT_Symbol *symbol;
00424   int hash_index, lines;
00425 
00426   /* Count lines used in table */
00427   lines = 0;
00428   for (hash_index = 0; hash_index < table->hash_size; hash_index++)
00429     {
00430       if (table->hash[hash_index] != NULL)
00431         lines++;
00432     }
00433   fprintf (out, "%s has %i entries (hash size %i, used %i):\n",
00434            table->name, table->symbol_count, table->hash_size, lines);
00435 
00436   /* For each hash_index in hash table */
00437   for (hash_index = 0; hash_index < table->hash_size; hash_index++)
00438     {
00439       /* Skip empty lines */
00440       if (table->hash[hash_index] == NULL)
00441         continue;
00442 
00443       fprintf (out, "%4i:", hash_index);
00444       for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00445            symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00446         {
00447           fprintf (out, " %i", symbol->value);
00448         }
00449       fprintf (out, "\n");
00450     }
00451 }
